data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.

attacks.name: Twin Play
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Scyther and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

data.name: Dartrix
data.flavorText: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

attacks.name: Sharp Blade Quill
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.

abilities.name: Wimp Out
abilities.text: During your first turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Pheromosa
data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

attacks.name: White Ray
attacks.text: If you have only 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix
data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

attacks.name: Beacon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.

abilities.name: Burning Fighter
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fire Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Froakie
data.flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

abilities.name: Frubbles
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Quagsire
data.flavorText: This carefree Pokémon has an easygoing nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.

abilities.name: Wash Out
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Frogadier
data.flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

abilities.name: Gale Shuriken
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Xurkitree
data.flavorText: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cablegram
attacks.text: If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Seviper
data.flavorText: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.text: Put 1 more damage counter on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

abilities.name: Floating Electrons
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Shuppet
data.flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Malamar
data.flavorText: It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

abilities.name: Psychic Recharge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Sudowoodo
data.flavorText: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.

abilities.name: Roadblock
abilities.text: Your opponent can't have more than 4 Benched Pokémon. If they have 5 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 4 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It's tough enough to run right through the night, and it's also a hard worker, but it's still just a youngster.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: They can detect the species of a living being—and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.

abilities.name: Precognitive Aura
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Garchomp in play, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Missile Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Poipole
data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Knockout Reviver
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

data.name: Buzzwole
data.flavorText: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

attacks.name: Sledgehammer
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: It changes so it looks like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.

data.name: Rockruff
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Guzzlord
data.flavorText: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

attacks.name: Lord's Valley
attacks.text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, discard the top 10 cards of your deck.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

attacks.name: Searching Magnet
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Metal Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.name: Magnezone
data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism to communicate with others of its kind.

attacks.name: Core Beam
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Celesteela
data.flavorText: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

attacks.name: Moon Raker
attacks.text: If the total of both players' remaining Prize cards is exactly 6, this attack can be used for Metal.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.

attacks.name: Core Beam
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Kartana
data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

attacks.name: Divine Paper
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Altaria
data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

abilities.name: Fight Song
abilities.text: Your Dragon Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Diancie
data.flavorText: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

attacks.name: Sparkling Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Diamond Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokémon.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Gabite
data.flavorText: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Garchomp
data.flavorText: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Royal Blades
attacks.text: If you played Cynthia from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.name: Swablu
data.flavorText: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Noibat
data.flavorText: They live in pitch black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Type: Null
data.flavorText: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Leafeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Breath of the Leaves
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Grand Bloom-GX
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

abilities.name: Instruct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Golisopod-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crossing Cut-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Charizard-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Storm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard the top 10 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Decidueye-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Feather Arrow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hollow Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Reshiram-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Scorching Column
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Vermilion-GX
attacks.text: You may attach up to 5 Fire Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Edge
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Path-GX
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from this Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ho-Oh-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Phoenix Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Phoenix Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Eternal Light-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 in any combination of Fire Pokémon-GX or Fire Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Turtonator-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shell Trap
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nitro Tank-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Articuno-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Legendary Ascent
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon. If you do, move any number of Water Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cold Crush-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from both Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Glaceon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Freezing Gaze
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities, except for Freezing Gaze.

attacks.name: Frost Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Polar Spear-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Greninja-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shuriken Flurry
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Haze Slash
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Shadowy Hunter-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 130 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Electrode-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Extra Energy Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 5 Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon, except Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, in any way you like. If you do, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn-GX
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Xurkitree-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flashing Head
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Rumbling Wires
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Lighting-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Add a card you find there to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mewtwo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Full Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Absorption
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psystrike-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Espeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the number of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Divide-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Banette-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon to another Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Chant
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Tomb Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Nihilego-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Empty Light
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Symbiont-GX
attacks.text: Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Naganadel-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Beast Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Ultra Beasts in play.

attacks.name: Jet Needle
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Stinger-GX
attacks.text: Both players shuffle their Prize cards into their decks. Then, each player puts the top 3 cards of their deck face down as their Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lucario-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aura Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Riolu during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Cantankerous Beatdown-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lycanroc-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bloodthirsty Eyes
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dangerous Rogue-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Zygarde-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cell Connector
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Verdict-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Buzzwole-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Absorption-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each of your remaining Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lycanroc-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Twilight Eyes
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splintered Shards-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your opponent's discard pile. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Umbreon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Call-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Darkrai-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Restoration
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. Then, attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Cleave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Dead End-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, that Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Guzzlord-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Eat Sloppily
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glutton-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Kartana-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Slice Off
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gale Blade
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Blade-GX
attacks.text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gardevoir-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Secret Spring
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fairy Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Infinite Force
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Twilight-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle 10 cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stakataka-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Wall
abilities.text: Your Ultra Beasts take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Assembly-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Prize card you have taken. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Scizor-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Danger Perception
abilities.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 100 or less, its attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cross-Cut-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Altaria-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bright Tone
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Euphoria-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Sylveon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magical Ribbon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Plea-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into your opponent's hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Noivern-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Distort
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Sonic Volume
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Special Energy cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Boomburst-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Gyro Unit
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Turbo Drive
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rebel-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Drampa-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Righteous Edge
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Berserk
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Big Wheel-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cynthia
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hiker
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and choose 1 of them. That player shuffles the other cards back into their deck. Then, put the card you chose on top of that deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Aether Foundation Employee
rules: Put 3 Pokémon that have "Alolan" in their names from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fisherman
rules: Put 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Guzma
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. If you do, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lady
rules: Search your deck for up to 4 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Aether Paradise Conservation Area
rules: Basic Grass and Basic Lightning Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take 30 less damage from the opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Shrine of Punishment
rules: Between turns, put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX (both yours and your opponent's).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Mt. Coronet
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put 2 Metal Energy cards from their discard pile into their hand.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Tapu Fini-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tapu Storm-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tapu Koko-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Aero Trail
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tapu Thunder-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Brooklet Hill
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for a Basic Water Pokémon or Basic Fighting Pokémon and, put it onto their Bench, and shuffle their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Tapu Bulu-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Nature's Judgment
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Tapu Wilderness-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tapu Lele-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Wonder Tag
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Energy Drive
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Tapu Cure-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
